com.digi.xbee.api.connection.android

Class CircularByteBuffer

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.digi.xbee.api.connection.android.CircularByteBuffer

  • public class CircularByteBuffer
extends Object
    Helper class used to store data bytes as a circular buffer.
    Since:
    1.2.0

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      CircularByteBuffer(int size)
      Instantiates a new CircularByteBuffer with the given capacity in bytes.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int availableToRead()
      Returns the available number of bytes to read from the byte buffer.
      void clearBuffer()
      Clears the circular buffer.
      int getCapacity()
      Returns the circular byte buffer capacity.
      int read(byte[] data, int offset, int numBytes)
      Reads the given amount of bytes to the given array from the circular byte buffer.
      int skip(int numBytes)
      Skips the given number of bytes from the circular byte buffer.
      int write(byte[] data, int offset, int numBytes)
      Writes the given amount of bytes to the circular byte buffer.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • CircularByteBuffer

        public CircularByteBuffer(int size)
        Instantiates a new CircularByteBuffer with the given capacity in bytes.
        Parameters:
        size - Circular byte buffer size in bytes.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if size < 1.

    • Method Detail

      • availableToRead

        public int availableToRead()
        Returns the available number of bytes to read from the byte buffer.
        Returns:
        The number of bytes in the buffer available for reading.
        See Also:
        getCapacity(), read(byte[], int, int)

      • clearBuffer

        public void clearBuffer()
        Clears the circular buffer.

      • getCapacity

        public int getCapacity()
        Returns the circular byte buffer capacity.
        Returns:
        The circular byte buffer capacity.

      • read

        public int read(byte[] data,
                int offset,
                int numBytes)
        Reads the given amount of bytes to the given array from the circular byte buffer.
        Parameters:
        data - Byte buffer to place read bytes in.
        offset - Offset inside data to start placing read bytes in.
        numBytes - Number of bytes to read.
        Returns:
        The number of bytes actually read.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if offset < 0 or if numBytes < 1.
        NullPointerException - if data == null.
        See Also:
        skip(int), write(byte[], int, int)

      • skip

        public int skip(int numBytes)
        Skips the given number of bytes from the circular byte buffer.
        Parameters:
        numBytes - Number of bytes to skip.
        Returns:
        The number of bytes actually skipped.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if numBytes < 1.
        See Also:
        read(byte[], int, int), write(byte[], int, int)

      • write

        public int write(byte[] data,
                 int offset,
                 int numBytes)
        Writes the given amount of bytes to the circular byte buffer.
        Parameters:
        data - Bytes to write.
        offset - Offset inside data where bytes to write start.
        numBytes - Number of bytes to write.
        Returns:
        The number of bytes actually written.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if offset < 0 or if numBytes < 1.
        NullPointerException - if data == null.
        See Also:
        read(byte[], int, int), skip(int)
